ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] jmx port is null, job fails
ygData.msgSnippet: The release 1.11.0 of heritrix fixes the bug with JMX port! I had some problems with NoSuchMet hodError exceptions, but solved them according to

The release 1.11.0 of heritrix fixes the bug with JMX port! I had some 
problems with NoSuchMet

hodError exceptions, but solved them according to  
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/3295

Thank  you, guys!



Alexander wrote:

> Sorry, i've got mistaken, actually i can't say if HEAD (heritrix
> 1.11.0) fixes the problem as i can't still run a job, there's another
> exception:
>
> 06359,type=CrawlService.Job registered to
> MBeanServerId=supernova_1158423101296,
> SpecificationVersion=1.2 Maintenance Release,
> ImplementationVersion=1.5.0_03-b0
> 7, SpecificationVendor=Sun Microsystems
> Exception in thread "StartNextJob" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:
> org.apache.commo
> ns.httpclient.HttpState.setCookiesMap(Ljava/util/SortedMap;)V
> at
> org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.configureHttpCookies(FetchHTTP.
> java:1169)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.configureHttp(FetchHTTP.java:11
> 26)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.initialTasks(FetchHTTP.java:104
> 3)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.runProcessorInitialTask
> s(CrawlController.java:1661)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.requestCrawlStart(Crawl
> Controller.java:1002)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler.startNextJobInternal(CrawlJ
> obHandler.java:1136)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler$3.run(CrawlJobHandler.java:
> 1113)
> at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
>
> Alexander wrote:
>
> > I have checked out and built heritrix 1.11.0, but the problem still
> > remains.
> >
> > Michael Stack wrote:
> >
> > > Try HEAD. I just committed an attempt at a fix. We are checking for
> > > the JMX_PORT being null when creating the Heritrix instance MBean name
> > > -- the JMX_PORT is part of the name if its not null -- but were not
> > > doing the same when creating the CrawlJob name (CrawlJob name also 
> tries
> > > to include JMX_PORT in its name).
> > >
> > > In standalone mode, Heritrix starts up the JVM's JMX Agent and 
> registers
> > > its MBeans here for remote clients to come visit. JMX_PORT
> > > (overrideable) is used to tell the JVM what port to set its JMX
> > > listening on.
> > >
> > > When running in a container, the JVM JMX Agent may or may not be 
> running
> > > but Heritrix assumes the container has a JMX Agent of its own running.
> > > They usually do. Tomcat does. Heritrix binds to the first Agent it
> > > finds (It should probably be more discriminate than this but will wait
> > > until there is a complaint before doing anything about it). So, there
> > > may be no JMX_PORT defined though there is a JMX Agent present for
> > > Heritrix to use.
> > >
> > > A refactoring of the crawl job name a while back seems to have
> > > introduced the bug. Let us know if the fix works for you.
> > >
> > > St.Ack
> > >
> > > hlm_bk wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Hi,
> > > >
> > > > I can't run a crawl job, it fails at ht.put(JmxUtils.JMX_PORT,
> > > > hht.get(JmxUtils.JMX_PORT)); line of code in
> > > > org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob when i start my job.
> > > > hht.get(JmxUtils.JMX_PORT) returns null and null pointer exception
> > > arises.
> > > >
> > > > Where can i specify jmx port?
> > > >
> > > > i'm even not sure if there's a jmx agent running. Maybe it's 
> possible
> > > > to tell heritrix to run without jmx support?
> > > >
> > > > My configuration:
> > > >
> > > > Heritrix 1.10.0
> > > > Tomcat 5.5.17
> > > > Java 1.5.0_03
> > > > Windows XP Pro
> > > >
> > > > thank you1
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
>
>
